glsa.title: pdnsd: Denial of Service and potential arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: pdnsd is vulnerable to a buffer overflow that may result in arbitrary code execution.

background.p: pdnsd is a proxy DNS server with permanent caching that is designed to cope with unreachable DNS servers.

description.p: The pdnsd team has discovered an unspecified buffer overflow vulnerability. The PROTOS DNS Test Suite, by the Oulu University Secure Programming Group (OUSPG), has also revealed a memory leak error within the handling of the QTYPE and QCLASS DNS queries, leading to consumption of large amounts of memory.

impact.p: An attacker can craft malicious DNS queries leading to a Denial of Service, and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
